title: Tommy Parkin
text:
Thomas Aitchison Parkin (born 1 February 1956) is an English retired professional <a href="Association%20football">football</a> <a href="midfielder">midfielder</a>. His nephews, <a href="Jacob%20Murphy">Jacob Murphy</a> and <a href="Josh%20Murphy">Josh Murphy</a>, also became professional footballers.
Career.
Born in <a href="Gateshead">Gateshead</a>, Parkin spent his youth career with <a href="Ipswich%20Town%20F.C.">Ipswich Town</a> and turned professional with Ipswich in December 1973, He was sent out on loan to <a href="Grimsby%20Town%20F.C.">Grimsby Town</a> during the <a href="1975%E2%80%9376%20Football%20League">1975–76 season</a> and then to <a href="Peterborough%20United%20F.C.">Peterborough United</a> the <a href="1976%E2%80%9377%20Football%20League">following season</a>. Later in 1977 he was loaned to <a href="Connecticut%20Bicentennials">Connecticut Bicentennials</a> of the <a href="North%20American%20Soccer%20League%20%281968%E2%80%9384%29">North American Soccer League</a>. He made his Ipswich debut against <a href="Cardiff%20City">Cardiff City</a> in the third round of the <a href="FA%20Cup">FA Cup</a> on 7 January 1978. Ipswich went on to win the FA Cup that season but Parkin wasn't part of the squad for the <a href="1978%20FA%20Cup%20Final">final</a> itself. Parkin had made fewer than 20 first team appearances by the age of 27.
Despite becoming a first team regular during the <a href="1983%E2%80%9384%20Football%20League">1983–84 season</a>, Parkin soon returned to being a reserve player. His final appearance for Ipswich was a League Cup defeat to <a href="Cambridge%20United%20F.C.">Cambridge United</a>, and he left he club in 1987. He subsequently joined <a href="Bury%20Town%20F.C.">Bury Town</a>, where he played until 1990. Parkin joined <a href="Wivenhoe%20Town%20F.C.">Wivenhoe Town</a> in the summer of 1990, playing 11 games until departing in September of that year for <a href="Harwich%20%26amp%3B%20Parkeston%20F.C.">Harwich & Parkeston</a>.
